intro: Hemisteirus psilotrichodes, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. Hemisteirus psilotrichodes is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
